core_constraints.name: skew_heap_insertion_rule
core_constraints.description: The given tree must be constructible by the recursive skew heap insertion procedure applied to some permutation of [1..n]. This includes: (1) each node's value â‰¤ its children's values (min-heap property); (2) the structural evolution follows the swap-and-insert rule. Assumed based on problem description.

core_constraints.name: binary_tree_validity
core_constraints.description: Input describes a valid binary tree with n nodes labeled 1 through n, each appearing exactly once. Assumed from guarantee in input section.

objective.description: Find the lexicographically smallest and largest input permutations that produce the given tree via skew heap insertion; if none exist, output 'impossible'.

invariant.name: skew_heap_construction_invariant
invariant.description: The insertion process maintains a min-heap ordered binary tree where structure depends deterministically on insertion order and recursive child-swapping. The reconstruction problem relies on reverse-engineering valid insertion sequences consistent with final tree topology and heap order.
